Course Objectives: Understand key software engineering concepts, including development methodologies, design patterns, and testing strategies.
Apply various software process models in practical scenarios.
Design, implement, and maintain software systems effectively.
Utilize advanced software testing techniques to ensure quality and reliability.
Prerequisites: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field
Basic knowledge of programming and system design

Seminar/Workshop Details: Seminar on Current Trends in Software Testing

Detailed Syllabus.Topic: Introduction to Software Engineering and Software Processes
Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 1: Introduction - Sommerville; Chapter 2: Software Processes - Sommerville
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Essay on the evolution of software engineering

Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 4: Software Requirements - Sommerville; Chapter 5: Requirements Engineering Process - Sommerville
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Develop a requirements specification document for a library management system

Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 5: System Modeling - Sommerville; Chapter 11: Design and Implementation - Sommerville
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Design an architecture for an online shopping system

Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 3: Agile Software Development - Sommerville; Chapter 2: Process Models in Software Engineering - Pressman
Chapter 6: Software Testing - Sommerville; Chapter 8: Software Testing Techniques - Pressman
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Prepare test cases for a given software module

Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 9: Software Evolution - Sommerville; Chapter 21: Software Maintenance - Pressman
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Case study on software maintenance challenges

Detailed Syllabus.Reading: Chapter 10: Socio-technical Systems - Sommerville; Chapter 25: Emerging Trends in Software Engineering - Pressman
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Research paper on the impact of IoT on Software Engineering

Detailed Syllabus.Activity: Guest lecture on Software Project Management
Detailed Syllabus.Assignment: Presentation on ethical issues in software development

Time Management Tips: Allocate specific times for reading and assignments each week to stay on schedule.
Use project management tools to track your progress and deadlines.

Mid-term project due by end of Week 4
Final project due by end of Week 8
End of semester exam on last day of Week 8
